Package it.unipr.sowide.actodes.registry

Class Registry

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unipr.sowide.actodes.registry.Registry
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PersistentRegistry, RegistryWrapper, TemporaryRegistry
    public class Registry
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The Registry class provides the default implementation of an actors registry. A registry maintains the bindings between the references and the actors of an actor space.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap<ActorReference,​Actor> actors
      Reference - actor map.
      static int MAX
      The default value for the maximum number of actors that the registry can be managed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Registry

        public Registry()
        Class constructor. It sets the maximum number of created actors to the default value.
        See Also:
        MAX

      • Registry

        public Registry​(int m)
        Class constructor.
        Parameters:
        m - the maximum number of actors that can be managed.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public Reference add​(Actor a)
        Adds a reference - actor pair. If the actor is new then this method creates automatically the actor reference.
        Parameters:
        a - the actor.
        Returns:
        the actor reference or null if the operation fails.

      • exist

        public boolean exist​(Reference r)
        Checks if a reference is associated with an actor.
        Parameters:
        r - the reference.
        Returns:
        true if there is an actor associated with such a reference and false otherwise.

      • get

        public Actor get​(Reference r)
        Gets the actor associated with a reference.
        Parameters:
        r - the reference.
        Returns:
        the actor. Note that the return value is null if there is not an actor associated with such a reference.

      • actors

        public java.util.Collection<Actor> actors()
        Gets the registered actors.
        Returns:
        the actors.

      • references

        public java.util.Collection<ActorReference> references()
        Gets the references of the registered actors.
        Returns:
        the references.

      • size

        public int size()
        Gets the number of registered actors.
        Returns:
        the number.

      • remove

        public void remove​(Reference r)
        Removes a reference - actor pair.
        Parameters:
        r - the reference.

      • lookup

        public Reference lookup​(java.lang.String n)
        Gets the reference of an actor.
        Parameters:
        n - the name bound to the reference.
        Returns:
        the reference or null if there is not a binding.

      • bind

        public boolean bind​(java.lang.String n,
                    ActorReference r)
        Binds a name to an actor reference.
        Parameters:
        n - the binding name.
        r - the reference.
        Returns:
        true if the is the binding is successful. Note that the binding is not possible when the name is already bound to a reference.

      • unbind

        public void unbind​(java.lang.String n,
                   ActorReference r)
        Unbinds a name from an actor reference.
        Parameters:
        n - the binding name.
        r - the reference.

      • subscribe

        public void subscribe​(Message m,
                      java.lang.String n)
        Subscribes the interest about the reference of an actor that is bound or will be bound to a specific name.
        Parameters:
        m - the subscription message.
        n - the binding name.

      • unsubscribe

        public void unsubscribe​(java.lang.String n,
                        ActorReference r)
        Cancel the subscription about the interest about the reference of an actor will be bound to a specific name.
        Parameters:
        n - the binding name.
        r - the subscriber reference.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the registry.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shutdowns the registry.
